trans-unit.source: Listing your application in the Azure Active Directory application gallery
trans-unit.target: Listing your application in the Azure Active Directory application gallery

trans-unit.source: A comprehensive guide to developer-oriented resources for Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: A comprehensive guide to developer-oriented resources for Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Listing your application in the Azure Active Directory application gallery
trans-unit.target: Listing your application in the Azure Active Directory application gallery

trans-unit.source: To list an application that supports single sign-on with Azure Active Directory in the <link><linkText>Azure AD gallery</linkText><title></title></link> and in the Azure Marketplace, the Azure AD team will need to verify your integration. This requires that you send the following information to <html></html>:
trans-unit.target: To list an application that supports single sign-on with Azure Active Directory in the <link><linkText>Azure AD gallery</linkText><title></title></link> and in the Azure Marketplace, the Azure AD team will need to verify your integration. This requires that you send the following information to <html></html>:

trans-unit.source: The username and password of a test user account in a test instance of Azure Active Directory that is able to sign into your application
trans-unit.target: The username and password of a test user account in a test instance of Azure Active Directory that is able to sign into your application

trans-unit.source: URL and/or instructions on how this test user should sign into the application
trans-unit.target: URL and/or instructions on how this test user should sign into the application

trans-unit.source: Provide a brief description of how your customers create the connection between your application and Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Provide a brief description of how your customers create the connection between your application and Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: This could be:
trans-unit.target: This could be:

trans-unit.source: Built into the application using the Azure AD consent framework
trans-unit.target: Built into the application using the Azure AD consent framework

trans-unit.source: By configuring Azure AD as an identity provider (SAML 2.0, WS-Federation, or OpenID Connect) using an you application’s administrative portal
trans-unit.target: By configuring Azure AD as an identity provider (SAML 2.0, WS-Federation, or OpenID Connect) using an you application’s administrative portal

trans-unit.source: By contacting someone in your organization to manually create the connection
trans-unit.target: By contacting someone in your organization to manually create the connection

trans-unit.source: If your application supports configuring Azure AD as an identity provider through a self-service administrative portal, then please also provide a test admin account for verification.
trans-unit.target: If your application supports configuring Azure AD as an identity provider through a self-service administrative portal, then please also provide a test admin account for verification.

trans-unit.source: After testing is completed, then the application can be listed in the Azure Active Directory application gallery and in the Azure Marketplace. Complete the questions below and send to <html></html>.
trans-unit.target: After testing is completed, then the application can be listed in the Azure Active Directory application gallery and in the Azure Marketplace. Complete the questions below and send to <html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Company Name:
trans-unit.target: Company Name:

trans-unit.source: Company Website:
trans-unit.target: Company Website:

trans-unit.source: Application Name:
trans-unit.target: Application Name:

trans-unit.source: Application Description (256 character limit):
trans-unit.target: Application Description (256 character limit):

trans-unit.source: Application Website (informational):
trans-unit.target: Application Website (informational):

trans-unit.source: Application Technical Support Website or Contact Info:
trans-unit.target: Application Technical Support Website or Contact Info:

trans-unit.source: Have you integrated your application with Azure AD and tested it (see <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory authentication scenarios</linkText><title></title></link>?
trans-unit.target: Have you integrated your application with Azure AD and tested it (see <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory authentication scenarios</linkText><title></title></link>?

trans-unit.source: Client ID of the application, as shown in the application details at https://manage.windowsazure.com:
trans-unit.target: Client ID of the application, as shown in the application details at https://manage.windowsazure.com:

trans-unit.source: Application Sign-Up URL where customers go to sign up for and /or purchase the application:
trans-unit.target: Application Sign-Up URL where customers go to sign up for and /or purchase the application:

trans-unit.source: Choose up to three categories for your application to be listed under (for available categories see the <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory Marketplace</linkText><title></title></link>:
trans-unit.target: Choose up to three categories for your application to be listed under (for available categories see the <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory Marketplace</linkText><title></title></link>:

trans-unit.source: Attach Application Small Icon (PNG file, 45px by 45px, solid background color):
trans-unit.target: Attach Application Small Icon (PNG file, 45px by 45px, solid background color):

trans-unit.source: Attach Application Large Icon (PNG file, 215px by 215px, solid background color):
trans-unit.target: Attach Application Large Icon (PNG file, 215px by 215px, solid background color):

trans-unit.source: Attach Application Logo (PNG file, 150px by 122px, transparent background color):
trans-unit.target: Attach Application Logo (PNG file, 150px by 122px, transparent background color):

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
